member.name: T:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer
member.summary: Abstract class for two files compare. One file is "expected", and one is "output" (received).

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.Options
member.summary: Options of comparizon (e.g. if letter case is ignored). Set up on comparer constructor, but content can be changed on run.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.Writer
member.summary: Writer to receive detailed results of comparison. Set up on comparer constructor.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.#ctor(Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions,Qhta.TestHelper.ITraceTextWriter)
member.summary: Simple constructor
member.param: Writer to receive detailed results of comparison

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.CompareFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Abstract method of file compare

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.IsEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a line is empty
member.returns: true if line contains no characted or only whitespace characters

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.AreEqual(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method for two string lines comparison. Compare options are applied.
member.returns: true is lines are equal

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.CompressSpaces(System.String)
member.summary: Method to compress subsequent spaces.
member.returns: Excessive spaces deleted

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.ShowLine(System.String,System.Nullable{System.ConsoleColor})
member.summary: Send a single line to the writer. Colors in options are applied.
member.param: Color of the text (if null then lef unchanged)

member.name: F:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.firstLine
member.summary: If we are at the beginning of trace output.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractFileComparer.ShowLines(System.String[],System.Nullable{System.ConsoleColor})
member.summary: Send a sequence of lines to the writer. Colors in options are applied.
member.param: Color of the text (if null then lef unchanged)

member.name: T:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions
member.summary: Represents comparing options

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.IgnoreEmptyLines
member.summary: If lines that are empty (without printable characters) are ignored in comparison

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.TrimLines
member.summary: If spaces starting and ending lines are trimmed before comparison

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.CompressSpaces
member.summary: If subsequent spaces are treated as single space

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If letter case is ignored

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.CompareCulture
member.summary: Culture to apply if ignore case

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.IgnoreAttributesOrder
member.summary: If attributes order in Xml compare is ignored

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.IgnoreIgnorableAttribute
member.summary: If mc:Ignorable attribute is ignored.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.WriteContentIfEquals
member.summary: if equal lines are written in text compare

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.DiffLimit
member.summary: How many different regions are synchronized before return false.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.SyncLimit
member.summary: What is the maximum distance to search for the same line when difference.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.EqualityMsg
member.summary: Message written if files are equal

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.InequalityMsg
member.summary: Message written if files are not equal

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.StartOfFile
member.summary: Line written at start of file compare.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.StartOfDiffRec
member.summary: Line written at start of received file different lines or elements

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.StartOfDiffExp
member.summary: Line written at start of expected file different lines or elements

member.summary: Line written at start of missing elements taken from expected file

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.StartOfDiffExc
member.summary: Line written at start of exceeded elements taken from received file

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.EndOfDiffs
member.summary: Line written at end of different lines or elements

member.summary: Color of received lines if shown in console.

member.summary: Color of expected lines if shown in console.

member.summary: Color of missing lines if shown in console.

member.name: F:Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions.ExcLinesColor
member.summary: Color of exceeded lines if shown in console.

member.name: T:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer
member.summary: Concrete comparer for text files

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.#ctor(Qhta.TestHelper.FileCompareOptions,Qhta.TestHelper.ITraceTextWriter)
member.summary: Constructor invoking base class constructor
member.param: Writer used to show different lines

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.CompareFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Implemented method of file comparison. Simply reads out whole files and invokes .
member.returns: true is both files are equal

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.CompareTexts(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Main text comparison method. Input texts are splitted to lines using '\n' character and "\r\n" character pairs. Then is called.
member.returns: true if both texts are equal

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.CompareLines(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Main method to compare collection of lines. Subsequent lines in the first and second collections are compared. If they are not equal then comparer tries to synchronize both collections, i.e. to find next equal lines. Unequal lines are shown using writer
member.returns: true if both lines collections are equal

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.TrySynchronize(System.String[],System.Int32,System.String[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: A method to synchronize output lines and expected lines if the difference is found. First different line in is pointed by and first different line in is pointed by Subsequent lines are compared in a maximum distance of . New indexes and point the fist equal lines. If synchronization was successful then the different lines are shown.
member.param: Index of first different line in collection
Index of first different line in collection
Maximum distance of search for the equal lines
Index of the first equal line in collection
Index of the first equal line in collection
member.returns: true if equal lines found

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.TrySync(System.String[],System.Int32,System.String[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Synchronization helper method. First tries to find equal line in first collection taking subsequent lines from the second one, next tries to find equal line in second collection taking subsequent lines from the first one. If not found in first and not in second trial then synchronization failes. Otherwise counts the distance of the first and the second trial and returns new indexes of the shorten one.
member.param: Index of search start in the first collection
Index of search start in the second collection
Index of found equal line in first collection, maxint if not found
Index of found equal line in second collection, maxint if not found
member.returns: true if equal lines found

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.TryFindEqualLines(System.String[],System.Int32,System.String[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Synchronization helper method. Takes subsequent lines from the second collection and searches for the equal line in the first collection. If the equal lines are found, both and point out equal lines. The search is limited to distance. If option is set then empty lines are ignored but are included in counting distance.
member.param: Index of search start in the first collection
Index of search start in the second collection
Index of found equal line in first collection, maxint if not found
Index of found equal line in second collection, maxint if not found
member.returns: true if equal lines found

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.TextFileComparer.TryFindEqualLine(System.String[],System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Synchronization helper method. Searches in a collection starting at for a line that is equal to . The search is limited to distance. After search the fist equal line is pointed by parameter. If option is set then empty lines are ignored but are included in counting distance.
member.returns: True if equal line was found. If not, the should be ignored

member.returns: true if both elements are equal

member.summary: Creates dictionary of elements using element names as keys. Returs true if, and only if, all elements have unique names.
Compares dictionaries of items of recElement and expElement

List of child elements of exp element
If unequal element should be shown
member.returns: true if both elements are equal

member.summary: Basic abstract test class

member.summary: If output test results to trace

member.summary: Filename to output test results

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.BreakOnFail
member.summary: If failed test case breaks the whole test

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.AcceptOnFail
member.summary: If failed test case breaks the whole test

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.ShowTestRunTime
member.summary: If failed test case breaks the whole test

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.Run
member.summary: Main method to run a test. Creates a TraceTextWriter to monitor a test and show results. First invokes method. Then , and . Additionally time of run is measured.
member.returns: True if test passes, false if failed

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.Init
member.summary: Creates trace text writer for test results. Console output is enabled by default. Other test output is controlled by properties.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.Prepare(Qhta.TestHelper.TestCase[]@)
member.summary: Abstract test preparation. Output parameter must be filled. If not - return false
member.param: Result collection of planned test cases
member.returns: if result collection prepared

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.Execute(Qhta.TestHelper.TestCase[],System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Abstract test execution. Planned test cases are given as input parameter. Result is number of test cases that were run and number of test cases failed.
member.param: Number of planned test cases that were run
member.returns: If all the test cases were run succesfully

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.AbstractTest.Finalize(Qhta.TestHelper.TestCase[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Virtual test finalization. Input parameters are: collection of planned test cases, and number of test cases that were run and number of test cases failed. Appriopriate messages are written to
member.param: Number of planned test cases that were run
member.returns: False only if not tests were planned

member.summary: Virtual method called on dispose

member.summary: Last written character

member.summary: Flush invokes abstract . This construction is needed to avoid premature cleaning when subclasses will invoke base method.

member.summary: This method is abstract and must be implemented in a subclass

member.summary: AutoFlush means that flush is invoked after each operation

member.summary: Indent unit consists of two spaces

member.summary: Indent level used at the beginning of each line

member.summary: Unlimited indent level increment

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.Unindent
member.summary: Indent level decrement imited to zero

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.Enabled
member.summary: If set to false then disables operations.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.WriteVisualNewLine
member.summary: If set then new lines are written visually, as "\n" sequence; To so, to write a "real" new line use method.

member.name: P:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.AllowIntelligentSpacing
member.summary: If set then "\n" and "\s" sequences at start of the string to write are treated specially. "\n" forces to write a new line if last char is not a new line character. "\s" forces to write a space if last char is not a space and is not an open punctuation character.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Basic write implementation. New lines and spaces interpreted according to controlling properties.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.WriteLine
member.summary: After WriteLine last char is '\n'.

member.name: M:Qhta.TestHelper.BufferedTextWriter.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Simply Write(str) and WriteLine();

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.

member.summary: Represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:System.Range.End

Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Range)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another Range object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Range.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Range object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Range.StartAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from start index to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:System.Range.EndAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: P:System.Range.All
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.summary: Slices the specified array using the specified range.
